Adjust battlers position by pressing X, then by chosing the battler to swap with.
Press Start once you are ready.
Confirm position swap with <color="yellow">X</color>, or press <color="yellow">Cancel</color> to cancel the operation.
How many do you wish to buy?
How many do you wish to sell?
Select a slot to create the save file.
Select the save file to load.
Unsaved data will be lost. Are you sure you want to close the game?
Unsaved data will be lost. Are you sure you want to go back to the title screen?

Greetings my Lord. How can I help you?
Our walls are strong, but our weak point remains the skies.
The fortress is surrounded by forests and the Gornich Bay protects us north. They can only attack from the west and the skies.
We must remain ready at all times. We are in charge of protecting the royal palace.
We are preparing a new defensive strategy in case of an attack from Ulyomnis.
There is no immediate threat, but we better be prepared!
Sire, if you need to rest, beds are available downstairs.
This place is so damn dead! Boring as hell! I'm not here to gossip, I wanna play dice!
Hi, my Lord. Please enjoy a lil' glass with us! Tell us about dae gossip from the castle.
I'm sorry but I can't join right now. Captain Warlok is waiting for me.
Ain't no worries! Please, come back next time to enjoy a few pints with your fellas!
Mum spends all day either at the well, or with her face burried in a book. Is that how I will be as an adult too?
We complement the militia in protecting the fortress and its inhabitants. They are better at fighting armies, while we excel at vanquishing monsters.
Our techniques are also more diverse and refined, as we have fought a plethora of different opponents.
Marks pay well, but always be on point! The targets Magnus finds quickly get hands on them.
I guess it's difficult for a newcomer. The competition here is fierce.
Magnus, our leader, is downstairs. He manages the members, talks with the militia and finds us good preys to hunt.
One of a kind, I'd say. He talks and hunts well. I just hunt, like an animal. I think we are all animals, after all.
Some hunters only stay in one area. They hunt what needs to be hunted. Whatever the target.
Some hunters are travelers. They only hunt big marks, with a nice price on their head. I have to say, they are usually pretty good.
We owe a lot to these hunters. Without them, I don't think we could make it. And honestly, they are better than us.
Although, I have to say, their manners sometimes don't match their technique...
The water from the well is so refreshing. But we have to moderate ourselves. Each person is allowed to draw water from the well only once a day.
Many preparations use water and it can also be used as a substitue to basic potions, although its effectiveness is inferior.
One should always use the most appropriate weapon type when fighting. But one should also consider elemental affinities.
Most enemies have a weakness. Syblings usually share the same affinities.
Here you can only find pre-made products. But some merchants also offer crafting services!
I have heard that some tools even allow to craft things in the wild!
Oh, my lord! I heard you were practicing your combat skills with Captain Warlok.
Before venturing outside, please consider checking out the various shops in town.
You can also find food at the tavern to prepare your next battle.
Since dice have no place here anymore, most of my friends go to the nearest village, Farment. But going through the Gramont Woods just for a dice roll? Hell nah!
My lord! May this beautiful day be filled with greatness and prowesses!
The militia watches out for the Ulyomnian enemy! It never sleeps.
His Majesty has felt... easily upset since Lady Alynea passed away. You know it better, right?
The finest weapons! Please have a look!
MP refund when exploiting el. weakness:
Bonus damage when target's health below
Melee damage scales with travelled distance
Gathers EP when healing another ally.
Gathers EP for each negative status effect.
Gathers EP when using a different ability.
Gathers EP when defeating an enemy.
Gathers EP when damaging an enemy.
Gathers EP when another ally is taking damage.
Gathers EP when exploiting an elemental weakness.
Gathers EP when granting another ally positive status effects.
Gathers EP when starting your turn with low HP.
Gathers EP when starting your turn. Scales with combat duration.
Gathers EP when parrying or evading an attack.
Gathers EP when moving during combat.
Gathers EP when another ally gets revived.
Gathers EP when landing a critical strike.
So you did dare to tread these Ulyomnian lands after all. Dagner, look! This is the cost of your thirst for conquest!
No Pernambulian business around! Opposition shall result in a bloodbath, close enough to what we witnessed today.
Now, withdraw what remains of your troops, or else the slaughter shall go on.
Let's get back to Pernambulis, my General.
There is no going back for your kind. Weaklings are not going back.
Weaklings do not know... They do not know the way of conquest. YOU do not know.
In the South, Pernambulis. In the North, Ulyomnis. At war for three decades.
A war to quench thirst of two men: Ulyomnian Emperor Terrakion IV, and Pernambulian King Aërnold Gravis.
The thirst for power... The power of Novus crystals. And the large and unstable power they provide.
Pernambulis claims ownership of the flying crystal structure, given it is mostly located on its territory. But Ulyomnis disagrees.
A war that revolves around supreme power. Such great power... Meaningless compared to what may exist.
This would be Dagner's last battle leading the army of Pernambulis.
Godfried Henri Markus Dagner, General of the Army of Pernambulis. The present trial shall decide your punishment for your barbarian acts and behaviour.
You are more a butcher than a war leader, seeking nothing but to quench thirst for conquest. Slaying both enemies and allies alike.
What use of an army who cannot fight? What use of a bunch of weaklings on a battlefield? Better just get rid of them.
Too much blood was shed in the name of your judgement for... weaklings. That blood will serve you no longer.
It is time you question your deeds, your acts, your intentions. On your own. The Army of Pernambulis you shall no longer command. This cannot be contested.
The Great Book of Laws is clear on that matter: you shall bear the same punishment you inflicted to those poor souls on the battlefield, soon enough.
It was clear: Dagner would be executed. Motive: crime against Pernambulis. The man would be considered a threat to the kingdom. A few hours in a cell first...
A few hours to... think. Never did I agree with those barbarian punishments. My father never considered abolishing those, despite us arguing when dicussing their use...
Maybe I will not meet glory in the end... Maybe I will die as a weakling.
And now we even have illusions in my own damn cell... What a day!
As if glory... was an illusion!
I can free you from the fate drawn upon you. Trust me, follow me and glory shall be yours. You are hungry, thristy... I can feel it. Come, the way is ahead.
The General's deceased body was carried by the shore of Gornich Bay, up North. The depths of the Bay would act as a proper graveyard for traitors and criminals...

Dagner was not executed in blood. No... They opted for a slow agony, a man paralyzed with every bit inside slowly getting torn apart by torture spells. Much less bloody than what the General was used to.
Some may have even said he was just sleeping... Sleeping in the depths. The cold, cold depths.
My Lord, I am finally here. I know you were expecting me.
Gamera... You know about my patience, don't you?
You know why I asked you to come here, don't you?
Yes, my Lord... But, wouldn't there be another way...?
What is your point Gamera? Feable creatures from your world have no meaningful lives to care for.
I... accomplished so much for you, my Lord. All my duties, even the most disgusting ones... Without even a bit of recognition from you?!
What did you expect from me? Compassion? Praise? You are such a foolish creature.
And now you are doubting. Doubting me and yourself. What were you of use all this time anyway, right? Did you even think of it?
Doubting life and death is like doubting my power. None shall doubt it! Because it exists, and it is large and great!
I will have to finish the job myself. The conquest goes on, Gravis. You better be prepared.
Gamera was once among my father's men. Although some... controversial events led him to leave and explore other realms.
Maybe life at the castle was a better plan in the end? Because life could have actually gone on by our side.
I was about to do the same mistake. A mistake which would not be the first... nor the last. I was foolish and young. But it still led me to where I am today.
Joachim, I would like a word.
The troops are doubting our power. I am worried they might commit mistakes.
They believe they are more than just pawns, that they have a right to make history. So I had to deal with some of them.
You do not have to bother with their thoughts. They do not know anything. They do not matter. And you should not care about them. At all.
Oh, and about Gravis... Just take care of the old man. The rest is my business. And you shall not mind it.
Can you take on this alone? That's quite a task...
Only weaklings seek for help. Am I mistaken?
I recently had a talk with my father about the recent events, the execution and whatnot. Coming to our usual disagreement, I decided to take a breath and went outside to change my mind.
My father was convinced there was no other way to treat criminals. Perhaps something could be done so those people could reflect on their acts?
Maybe my thoughts and acts were immature. Maybe things would have been different if they were not...?
J'entends beaucoup dire, sir, que sa Majesté votre Père est très... remué lorsqu'on remet ses idées en question, comme vous dites.
Vous n'avez pas idée, capitaine. Vous n'avez pas idée... Il n'y avait que Mère qui avait le don pour le calmer... et le raisonner, accessoirement.
J'avais besoin d'air. Depuis l'exécution du général Dagner, nous ne nous adressons plus un mot.
Je pense que sa Majesté est tourmenté car il n'aurait jamais dû donner du pouvoir à cet homme. Et selon vos dires, il n'aime pas se remettre en question.
Dites-moi... Seriez-vous partant pour une petite session en extérieur ? Vous m'aviez parler d'une envie d'apprendre à manier le fer.
Je pourrais vous montrer quelques gestes qui pourraient vous servir, l'envie vous prendrait de vous promener en terre moins paisible qu'ici.
Je vous remercie de votre bonne mémoire, capitaine. Je vous suis.
Alors partons. Nous avons du pain sur la planche. Et de la vermine à chasser.
Je vous laisse vous préparer, sir. Retrouvez-moi à l'entrée de la forteresse dès que vous serez prêt.
Oh et ne vous tracassez pas pour votre équipement. J'emmène ce qu'il faut sur le terrain.
Do you wish to skip this scene?
